page.title: 19THE FONABY SACK cont.
page.content: It took thirteen horses and one pony to get it down the field, then things started to die and the farmer thought he'd better take it back before he died!' So the story goes that the stone sack was taken from the field and down to Fonaby Bottom, or to a farmyard between the two, because it interfered with ploughing. The horses and other animals started to die and it is said that the farmers son became ill. Witnesses at the time reckoned that the stone almost went back on its own but the farmer said he decided to take it back and they say one pony took it back. I don't know what happened then but the stone is still in the same field from which it originally came.
